required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MUSic Therapy to Improve Quality Of Life in Sickle Cell Disease (MUSIQOLS)
clinical_study.official_title: MUSic Therapy to Improve Quality Of Life in Sickle Cell Disease (MUSIQOLS): A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this pilot study is to investigate the effects of a 6-session music therapy protocol on the pain, mood, quality of life, coping skills, and self-efficacy of adult patients with sickle cell disease (SCD) as compared to adult patients with SCD who receive standard care alone. The investigators will also determine the feasibility (delivery, acceptability, and usefulness) of the music therapy intervention for pain management and quality of life.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Physical Function Short Form 4a
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-test at baseline and post-test at 10 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Adult Sickle Cell Quality of Life Measurement Information System (ASCQ-Me)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-test at baseline and post-test at 10 weeks
primary_outcome.description: A patient-reported outcome measurement system that addresses the physical, social, and emotional impact of SCD. ASCQ-Me scores are calculated in the direction of overall health, with higher ASCQ-Me scores indicating better health.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Emotional Distress-Anxiety Short Form 4a
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-test at baseline and post-test at 10 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Emotional Distress-Depression - Short Form 4a
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-test at baseline and post-test at 10 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Fatigue - Short Form 4a
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-test at baseline and post-test at 10 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Ability to Participate in Social Roles and Activities - Short Form 4a
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-test at baseline and post-test at 10 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Ability to participate in social roles and activities (4 questions)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Pain Interference - Short Form 4a
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-test at baseline and post-test at 10 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Sickle Cell Self-Efficacy Scale (SCSES)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-test at baseline and post-test at 10 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: A nine-item Likert scale originally developed for adults with SCD to assess patients' beliefs in their ability to manage their own SCD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Coping Skills Questionnaire - Sickle Cell Disease (CSQ-SCD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-test at baseline and post-test at 10 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: 80-item questionnaire that assesses coping strategies relevant to SCD

secondary_outcome.measure: Electronic Sickle Cell Disease Pain Diary
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily entries for 2 weeks at baseline and daily entries for 2 weeks post-intervention
secondary_outcome.description: A multidimensional pain diary assessing daily pain intensity, location, description, cause, and interference with daily activities

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Sleep Disturbance - Short Form 4a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-test at baseline and post-test at 10 weeks

other_outcome.description: Interview questions will focus on the patient's current pain, his/her experience of the music therapy sessions, and whether anything could have been done differently to improve the music therapy sessions.

arm_group.description: Patient receives 6 sessions of music therapy with a board-certified music therapist. Patient will learn various music interventions for pain management that he/she will utilize at home.
Patient receives standard care alone. Patient will receive music therapy sessions following completion of the post-test.

intervention.description: Patient receives 6 sessions of music therapy with a board-certified music therapist. Patient will learn various music interventions for pain management that he/she will utilize at home.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is 18 years or older
- Subject has a SCD diagnosis
- Subject fits chronic pain criteria in SCD
- Subject has a working email address
- Subject has access to a mobile device with email and internet capabilities
- Subject is able to speak and understand English
- Subject has attended at least 50% of his/her scheduled outpatient visits to the Adult SCD Clinic in the last 12 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has a significant visual impairment that has not been corrected
- Subject has a significant hearing impairment that has not been corrected
- Subject has a significant cognitive impairment that would prevent subject from participating in the study

link.description: Website for UH Connor Integrative Health Network
